newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia plans to merge state banks - report.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia plans to merge state banks - report.

text.p: Indonesia plans to merge its seven state-owned banks into four entities to improve competitiveness, the Bisnis Indonesia daily reported on Monday.
It said PT Bank Negara Indonesia, PT Bank Expor Impor Indonesia, PT Bank Dagang Negara and PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia would emerge from the consolidation.
The daily did not give details which bank would merge with the three other state banks, PT Bank Tabungan Negara, PT Bank Pembangunan Indonesia and PT Bank Bumi Daya.
Official confirmation was not immediately available.

However, it financial markets have long speculated about the move. Brokers and dealers have said the government was planning to merge its state banks to make them more effective to face free trade agreements which will be implemented by 2003 under a plan prepared by the Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN).
Brunei, Malaysia, the Philippines, Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam are the current members of ASEAN. Burma, Laos and Cambodia are scheduled to join later this year.
